title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 October 2015 - XWiki
content:
<benoitc> has quit  
00:25 <benoitc> has joined #xwiki  
00:42 <Slashman> has quit  
00:53 <abusenius> has quit  
01:01 <woshilapin> has quit

07:55 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:10 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:11 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:30 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <zzeroo> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <zzeroo> Hi I need help to get the document tree working. Til xwiki6 I've used this solution: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/List+Children+Of+Current+Document to list all sub pages of a page. But with xwiki 7.2 the result is empty  
10:10 <zzeroo> How can I set the current page as root= option to {{documentTree /}}/  
10:11 <zzeroo> How can I set the current page as root= option to {{documentTree /}}?  
10:12 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <vmassol> zzeroo: interesting, we need to check if we've broken something  
10:16 <vmassol> now there's a much better solution with the new documentTree macro  
10:17 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro  
10:17 <vmassol> oh I see you've found it  
10:17 <vmassol> adding doc  
10:18 <vmassol> check this diff zzeroo  
10:20 <vmassol> tmortagne, mflorea: do you think you could check why http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/List+Children+Of+Current+Document wouldn't be working in 7.2? (I'm starting a meeting now)  
10:20 <vmassol> thanks  
10:22 <zzeroo> vmassol: I studdy this pages for hours. What is a generic way to set the root with the current page? {{documentTree root="document:$doc" /}} dosn't work  
10:22 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <mflorea> zerroo: did you check the description of the root parameter? http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro#HParameters  
10:28 <tmortagne> zzeroo: you sure your {{documentTree root="document:$doc" /}} is inside velocity macro ?  
10:33 <mflorea> the script from "List Children Of Current Document" work for me on 7.3-SNAPSHOT  
10:34 <vmassol> ok cool thanks, we need more info from zzeroo  
10:34 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <zzeroo> tmortagne: Thank you. I've forget the velocity tags. First problem solved. My xwiki version is 7.2 and the "List Children Of Current Document" shows nothing on a page with subpages. I try to update  
10:45 <vmassol> zzeroo: ah yes I guess that script doesn't handle nested spaces but it should still work for non nested spaces  
10:45 <vmassol> but that's normal  
10:46 <tmortagne> vmassol: from what I understand zzeroo use the document tree macro, not sure why we are talking about http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/List+Children+Of+Current+Document script  
10:46 <vmassol> tmortagne: because he mentioned it ddidn't work  
10:47 <vmassol> "Hi I need help to get the document tree working. Til xwiki6 I've used this solution: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/List+Children+Of+Current+Document to list all sub pages of a page. But with xwiki 7.2 the result is empty"  
10:47 <vmassol> (I missed the subpage part initially)  
10:52 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
11:00 <mflorea> zzeroo: the script is ok. There are two cases:  
11:00 <mflorea> (1) the passed document is terminal (not a space home page) --> the child pages from anywhere in the wiki are found. This works.  
11:00 <mflorea> (2) the passed document is a space home page ---> only the child pages from that space (without including the subspaces) are found. If you want to look in subspaces too, then the script needs to be modified, but this wasn't it's initial intent.  
11:02 <mflorea> in other words: the script should continue to work fine for your existing pages. Now, if you start creating nested documents/spaces then this script is not useful anymore and you should switch to the document tree macro.  
11:02 <vmassol> mflorea: maybe you could add this text to the page (since you've workd to analyse it)?  
11:04 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <Trefex> hi all, tmortagne vmassol how are you doing :)  
11:08 <Trefex> we are now migrating mediawiki to xwiki, and is working more or less fine, except code blocks which are not supported  
11:08 <Trefex> however, now i get something strange  
11:09 <Trefex> i get this in my list of space http://imgur.com/VjytumX  
11:09 <Trefex> spaces\*  
11:09 <Trefex> which is generated with the following code: https://paste.fedoraproject.org/275740/42089751/  
11:09 <Trefex> now, i want to know, where is the "kettle ?" entry coming from?  
11:10 <Trefex> the space doesn't exist, so what's going on there  
11:10 <tmortagne> usually mean you don't have any space home page (WebHome) for space kettke  
11:10 <tmortagne> but you still have some pages in this space  
11:10 <tmortagne> what does not exist is not the space but the target of the link (which is the space home page)  
11:11 <Trefex> ah i see  
11:11 <Trefex> you are correct  
11:21 <zzeroo> Is there a way to show the documentTree complete expanded?  
11:38 <Trefex> tmortagne: thanks we fixed it  
11:38 <Trefex> other small question  
11:38 <Trefex> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Howtoincreasethemaximumattachmentsize  
11:38 <Trefex> is this the correct way to increase attachmint size on file based attachments?  
11:43 <Trefex> it seems the official documentation does not work for sub-wikis  
11:43 <Trefex> i followed this guide http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Attachments#HSizeLimit  
11:44 <zzeroo> Trefex: Try to restart tomcat. This solved it by me last time  
11:45 <Trefex> zzeroo: ok thanks, i shall try it  
11:51 <Trefex> it's still too large zzeroo  
11:51 <Trefex> anybody got any ideas?  
12:00 <Trefex> well tmortagne if you have any ideas, i'm ready :)  
12:11 <fcharton> has quit  
12:15 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <benedict> hi folks, i am using xwiki 7.2 with LDAP. Everything works very well, but i got one problem: I have two "mail" attributes in LDAP and i want xwiki to take both of them in the mail field, is that possible?  
12:32 <tmortagne> Trefex: looks like XWIKI-12032  
12:46 <gsmeria> has quit  
13:06 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:41 <zzeroo> Hello again, I try to upload an .docx document as attachment. This fails with an error like this one: http://pastebin.ca/3183980  
14:42 <zzeroo> I use the file system store. PDF and Zip files are working ok  
14:45 <vmassol> zzeroo:are you sure pdf and zip work when you use nested spaces?  
14:45 <vmassol> (just to rule out NS)  
14:46 <vmassol> the error doesn't look like it's related to the type of oducment  
14:46 <vmassol> \*document  
14:47 <tmortagne> note that from what I see in the code this happen only if Tika fail to parse the content so it actually could happen for some attachments and not others  
14:48 <vmassol> so the fact that the Entity is created with some null values would be a side effect of that problem  
14:48 <tmortagne> not really  
14:48 <tmortagne> it just not trying to get the reference at all otherwise  
14:49 <vmassol> k  
14:49 <tmortagne> the nullpointer seems to indicate that the XWikiAttachment does not have any filename  
14:49 <tmortagne> the IllegalArgumentException I mean  
14:50 <vmassol> so we're probably missing some check somewhere then  
14:50 <tmortagne> zzeroo: it would be great if you could create a jira issue and attachment to it a file on which you can reproduce the issue  
14:50 <vmassol> (if it doesn't raise an exception)  
14:50 <zzeroo> The attachments are created but if i download them they contain some html from the Page. very strange  
14:57 <Ramona1> has quit  
15:08 <Trefex> tmortagne: thanks for the link, however I'm not sure how to change the setting in the sub-wiki in the first place  
15:54 <zzeroo> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12667  
15:54 <zzeroo> ^^
